ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.controller

Class MetaController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.controller.MetaController

  • public class MetaController
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs all the high level tasks required to complete the overall routine. The MetaController class represents the high level of the controller. This class's concern is to ensure that the robot completes the entire routine consisting of reaching a tree of rings, obtaining the rings, and returning them back to the initial location. To achieve this goal, the MetaController determines which calls should be made to the DomainController and how the robot should react to the outcome of those calls. The DomainController class in turn handles the subtleties of each subtask. Additionally, the MetaController makes sure that the appropriate external conditions are met before requesting that a given subtask is performed. These external conditions are defined by the executor of the subtask (usually the DomainController).
    See Also:
    DomainController

      • run

        public void run()
         throws OdometerException
        Performs all the required subtasks involved in the ring collection routine. This includes everything from localization, tunnel traversal, and ring collection. The method returns once the entire routine has been performed.
        Throws:
        OdometerException - If the Odometer class has not yet been instantiated.
